org.openadaptor.auxil.processor.simplerecord
Class FilterProcessor

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.auxil.simplerecord.AbstractSimpleRecordProcessor
          org.openadaptor.auxil.processor.simplerecord.FilterProcessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IDataProcessor
public class FilterProcessor
extends AbstractSimpleRecordProcessor

Pass or discard records depending on the evaluation of a boolean Expression.

Note that pass/discard logic may be inverted via discardMatches property.

Author:
Eddy Higgins

Field Detail

filterExpression

protected IExpression filterExpression
Boolean expression whose

discardMatches

protected boolean discardMatches
Flag indicating if matches are discarded or retained (discarded or passed).

By default, matches are discarded, and non-matches are passed.

FilterProcessor

public FilterProcessor()
Method Detail

setFilterExpression

public void setFilterExpression(IExpression filterExpression)
This specifies the expression which will be evaluated.

The expression must evaluate to a Boolean

Parameters:
filterExpression - expression to be evaluated.

getFilterExpression

public IExpression getFilterExpression()
Return the expression to be evaluated.

Returns:
IExpression which will be evaluated.

setFilterExpressionString

public void setFilterExpressionString(java.lang.String filterExpressionString)
                               throws ExpressionException
Convenience accessor for setExpression, which only specifies the expression String.

If other expression properties (e.g. type mapping) are required, then the alternative accessor should be used, or the properties must be set subsequently through other means (programmatic or whatever)

The expression must generate a Boolean result.

Parameters:
filterExpressionString - String containing the expression to be evaluated.
Throws:
ExpressionException - if an IExpression cannot be created from the expression String.

setDiscardMatches

public void setDiscardMatches(boolean discardMatches)
Set flag indicating if matches will cause records to be passed or discarded.

By default, matches are discarded, and non-matches are passed.

Parameters:
discardMatches - boolean flag, where true means discard matching records.

getDiscardMatches

public boolean getDiscardMatches()
Get flag indicating if matches will cause records to be passed or discarded.

Returns:
boolean, true if matches are to be discarded, false otherwise.

processSimpleRecord

public java.lang.Object[] processSimpleRecord(ISimpleRecord simpleRecord,
                                              boolean alreadyCloned)
                                       throws RecordException
Apply the filter expression to an incoming record, and discard or pass the record based on the result.

Note alreadyCloned is ignored, as no modification should be made to the incoming record anyway.

Specified by:
processSimpleRecord in class AbstractSimpleRecordProcessor
Parameters:
simpleRecord - record to be checked.
alreadyCloned - flag which is ignored here
Returns:
Object[] which will be empty if the record is discarded, or contain the record if not.
Throws:
RecordException - if expression cannot be evalueated, or doesn't return a Boolean

testCondition

protected boolean testCondition(ISimpleRecord simpleRecord)
                         throws RecordException
Test the filter expression against an ISimpleRecord.

Expression should be returning a Boolean value.

Parameters:
simpleRecord - the record under test
Returns:
boolean result of expression evaluation
Throws:
RecordException - if 'filterExpression' cannot be evaluated, or doesn't return a Boolean

validate

public void validate(java.util.List exceptions)
Description copied from interface: IDataProcessor
This method checks that the current state of an implementation is "meaningful". Implementations of IDataProcessor are typically beans with zero-arg constructors. Implementations are encouraged to add exception to the list parameter rather than throwing them. This allows the calling code to collate the exceptions. If the implementation is an IComponent then the exceptions should be a ValidationException.

Specified by:
validate in interface IDataProcessor
Overrides:
validate in class AbstractSimpleRecordProcessor

Return a String view of this filter 'statement'.

Returns pseudo-code which is java-like to a point.

String representation of this filter.
